definitions.definition: used when the subject of the verb is "I" and the object is the same person:
examples: I bought myself a new coat.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize "I" as the subject of a sentence:
examples: I myself don't like a heavy meal at lunchtime.
My husband and myself were delighted with the gift.

definitions.definition: alone or without help from anyone else:

examples: I never get an hour to myself.

definitions.definition: not to be, seem, or feel as happy or as healthy as usual:
examples: I went to see the doctor because I haven't been feeling myself lately.

definitions.definition: used when describing your state of mind when you are physically ill:
examples: I'm well enough in myself (= happy) - I've just got this nagging headache.
